other_tests.procedure_name: CT ABD & PELVIS W & W/O CONTRAST, ADDL SECTIONS
other_tests.findings: The liver demonstrates a subtly nodular appearance with caudate lobe hypertrophy, commonly seen in cirrhosis. The spleen is enlarged. The left adrenal gland shows an 18 x 9 mm nodule compatible with adenoma. The kidneys show mildly delayed excretion of contrast on the right, along with mild hydronephrosis and perinephric stranding. A 3 mm stone is seen in the distal ureter. Sigmoid diverticulosis is seen, with a focal area of thickened sigmoid wall and mild fat stranding around it.
